title: Woman sexually harassed using in-flight chat system on Virgin Atlantic plane
text:
Legal expert Jessica Van Meir was sexually harassed on a plane (Picture: Twitter)

A woman was sent unsolicited messages on an in-flight chat system by someone called ‘big d*** swinger’.

Legal expert Jessica Van Meir was ‘sexually harassed’ by several users while flying with Virgin Atlantic on Saturday.

She later shared screenshots on Twitter of the messages she received on her personal screen.

Ms Van Meir, who works for legal firm McAllister Olivarius, was initially called a ‘tidy babe’ by someone named ‘smacks baccy tin’ who was sitting nine rows away.

Another passenger called ‘big d*** swinger’ then posted smiley faces in response to the message.

The communications continued with ‘dirty mike’ adding ‘welcome to hell’ and telling her she was ‘in the danger zone’.

She was sent these messages over a chat system (Picture: Twitter)

Jessica Van Meir reported the messages to flight attendants (Picture: Twitter)

Ms Van Meir warned the passengers they could get in trouble, replying: ‘I work for a law firm that specialises in online sexual harassment. Enjoy being reported to Virgin.’

She later posted the interactions online and said the flight attendants had been very helpful when she reported the harassment.

Cambridge University graduate Ms Van Meir tweeted: ‘I was on a Virgin Atlantic flight, and I unexpectedly received these sexually harassing messages on my screen.

‘I was in 55C. The flight attendants were helpful and dealt with it swiftly.

‘Have any other women had this happen to them?’

Ms Van Meir, who is originally from the US and now lives in the UK, urged Virgin Atlantic to make changes so the harassment would not happen again.

Passengers are currently able to communicate, play games and order drinks over a ‘seat to seat’ chat service.

Ms Van Meir added: ‘Virgin Atlantic, you should probably take measures to prevent this from happening by flagging specific language and putting in place a reporting function on the chat to report abusive users.’

She was targeted by several people (Picture: Twitter)

Jessica Van Meir is a legal expert and works in the UK (Picture: Twitter)

A Virgin Atlantic spokesperson said: ‘We were extremely concerned to hear of the incident reported on-board one of our flights and are investigating as a matter of urgency.

‘We want all of our customers to have the best possible experience when they fly with us, and have zero tolerance for any disruptive or inappropriate behaviour.

‘We’re grateful to our cabin crew who supported our customer following this incident and would like to apologise for the distress caused.

‘We are now reviewing our entertainment systems to ensure this does not happen again.’

description: A woman was sent unsolicited messages on an inflight chat system by someone called 'big d*** swinger'.
